embedded_feature_title: Proportion of the Population in Poverty in San Diego by Census Tract
graph_title: Proportion of population living below the national poverty line, by demographic characteristic
indicator_name: Proportion of population living below the national poverty line, by demographic characteristic
DG_GOAL: Goal 1: End poverty in all its forms everywhere
SDG_TARGET:
##Regional Context:
  At the adoption of the U.N SDGs in 2015, 14.5% of the population in San Diego Lived below the U.S poverty line. 
  In order to achieve the target, the region needs to reduce the poverty rate to 7.25% of the population.
  
Target 1.2: By 2030, reduce at least by half the proportion of adults and children of all ages living in poverty  in all its dimensions according to national definitions
SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 1.2.1: Proportion of population living below the national poverty line, by demographic characteristic
SDG_SERIES_DESCR: The small blue button in the upper right hand corner of the map allows layers for each demographic  characteristic to be turned on or off. The region is divided into census tracts with each tract having its own poverty  rate estimate. Blue colored tracts have achieved the goal of a poverty rate of 7.25% or less. Uncolor census tracts are where data is not currently available.
STAT_CONC_DEF:
## Definition:
  The U.S poverty rate is the percentage of the total population living below the U.S poverty line. As of 2021, 
  the U.S poverty line is an annual income of $12,880 per individual or $26,500 for a family of four. Further 
  information on this indicator can be found here https://unstats.un.org/sdgs/metadata/files/Metadata-01-02-01.pdf
DATA_SOURCE: U.S Census American Community Survey 5-Year Estimates for San Diego County
